sen.j: 九世片山九郎右衛門（きゅうせい・かたやま・くろうえもん。1930年8月26日 -）は能シテ方観世流能楽師。
sen.e: Kuroemon KATAYAMA (the 9th)
Kuroemon KATAYAMA (the 9th)
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Kuroemon KATAYAMA IX (August 26, 1930 -) is a Noh actor of the shite-kata (lead role) Kanze-ryu School.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。FBに従い、原文を1文にし、下セルと統合しました。

sen.j: 京都片山家九世当主（片山家能楽・京舞保存財団理事長）。
sen.e: Katayama is the 9th head of the Kyoto Katayama family (The board chairman of the Katayamake Nohgaku Kyobu hozon zaidan (the foundation of protecting the Katayama family's heritage of Nohgaku and Kyobu dance.))
sen.cmt: 「片山家能楽・京舞保存財団」は仮訳だそうです。
sen.e: Katayama is the 9th head of the Kyoto Katayama family (The board chairman of the Katayamake Nohgaku Kyobu hozon zaidan - the foundation of protecting the Katayama family's heritage of Nohgaku and Kyobu dance.)
sen.cmt: punctuation Note: double, triple, etc., parenthesis are very confusing to read and can often be remedied with a simple hyphen
sen.e: Katayama is the ninth head of the Kyoto Katayama family (President of the Katayamake Nogaku Kyobu Hozon Zaidan (Katayama Family Noh and Kyoto Dance Preservation Foundation)).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。スペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 重要無形文化財保持者各個指定（人間国宝）。
sen.e: He is the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property-individual designation-(Living National Treasure.)
He is the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property, designated as a Living National Treasure.
sen.cmt: grammar, punctuation
sen.e: He is an Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.e: He is a member of the Japan Art Academy.
He is a member of the Japan Art Academy.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He is a member of the Japan Art Academy.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: He is the board chairman of The Association for Japanese Noh Plays.
He is the board chairman of The Association for Japanese Noh Plays.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He is president of the Japan Noh Association.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 1930年、八世片山九郎右衛門（片山博通）と上方舞井上流の井上八千代四世 井上八千代（愛子）の長男として生れる。
sen.e: In 1930, he was born as the eldest son between Kuroemon KATAYAMA, the 8th (Hiromichi KATAYAMA) and Yachiyo INOUE (the 4th), Aiko of the Inoue school of Kamigatamai (dance).
In 1930, he was born as the eldest son between Kuroemon KATAYAMA, the 8th (Hiromichi KATAYAMA) and Yachiyo INOUE (the 4th), Aiko of the Inoue school of Kamigatamai (dance).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Katayama was born in 1930 as the eldest son of Kuroemon KATAYAMA VIII (Hiromichi KATAYAMA) and Yachiyo INOUE IV (Aiko) of the Kamigatamai dance Inoue-ryu School.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。補足しました。

sen.e: His real and the former name is Hirotaro.
His real and former name is Hirotaro.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: His real name (previous name) is Hirotaro.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 弟に片山慶次郎、杉浦元三郎がいる。
sen.e: He has younger brothers, Keijiro KATAYAMA and Motosaburo SUGIURA.
He has two younger brothers, Keijiro KATAYAMA and Motosaburo SUGIURA.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: His younger brothers are Keijiro KATAYAMA and Motosaburo SUGIURA.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。two を削除しました。

sen.j: 5歳で初舞台を踏んで以来、父および観世華雪、観世雅雪に師事し、京観世のやわらか味と観世銕之亟家系統の幽玄静穏な芸味を身につける。
sen.e: Since he made his first appearance on the stage at the age of 5, he learnt from his father, Kasetsu KANZE and Gasetsu KANZE, and acquired the art of softness of Kyokanze (the Kanze school in Kyoto) and quiet beauty and calmness of the line of school of Tetsunojo KANZE.

Since he made his first appearance on stage at the age of 5, he learned from his father, Kasetsu KANZE and Gasetsu KANZE, and acquired the art of softness of Kyokanze (the Kanze school in Kyoto) and quiet beauty and calmness of the of the school of Tetsunojo KANZE.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Since making his first appearance on stage at the age of five, he studied under his father, Kasetsu KANZE and Gasetsu KANZE to acquire the gentle style of the Kyoto Kanze school and the subtle grace of the Tetsunojo KANZE lineage.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。スペルアウトしました。

sen.e: In 1985, he announced the succession to Kuroemon's stage name.
In 1985, he announced the succession to the stage name of Kuroemon.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: In 1985, he succeeded the stage name of Kuroemon.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。 IXを削除しました。

sen.j: 以降芸術祭 (文化庁)優秀賞（3回）、芸術院賞、紫綬褒章などを受け、1995年芸術院会員、2001年人間国宝。
sen.e: After that, he won the Outstanding Performance Award (Agency for Cultural Affairs) at Art Festival (3 times), Award of the Japan Art Academy and received, Shiju hosho (medal of honor with purple ribbon), and he became a member of the Japan Art Academy in 1995 and in 2001, he was designated to the Living National Treasure.

After that, he won the Outstanding Performance Award (Agency for Cultural Affairs) at Art Festival (3 times), Award of the Japan Art Academy and received, Shiju hosho (medal of honor with purple ribbon), and he became a member of the Japan Art Academy in 1995 and in 2001, he was designated as a Living National Treasure.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: He went on to win the Arts Festival (Agency for Cultural Affairs) award for excellence (three times), the Art Academy Prize and the Shiju Hosho (Order of the Purple Ribbon) as well as being made a member of the Art Academy in 1995 a Living National Treasure in 2001.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。スペルアウトしました。

sen.j: そのほか能楽体関係の要職を歴任。
sen.e: He also filled successively the important posts of Nohgaku-related associations.
He also successively filled the important posts of Nohgaku-related associations.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: He also successively held important posts related to professional Noh bodies.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 安定した端正な芸風で知られる。
sen.e: His way of art is known as stable and neat.
His art is known as being stable and neat.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: He is known for his stable, neat style.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 子に五世井上八千代（観世三千子）、片山清司。
sen.e: Among his children are Yachiyo INOUE (the 5th), Yachiyo INOUE and Kiyoshi KATAYAMA.
Among his children are Yachiyo INOUE (the 5th), Yachiyo INOUE and Kiyoshi KATAYAMA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: His children are Yachiyo INOUE V (Michiko KANZE) and Kiyoshi KATAYAMA.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。 ⅣをⅤにし、ウェブに合わせ原文訳文修正しました。

sen.e: In 1936, he made his first appearance on the stage of Shimai (Noh dance in plain clothes), "Shojo."
In 1936, he made his first appearance on stage of Shimai (Noh dance in plain clothes), "Shojo."
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: 1936: Made his first stage appearance in the informal Noh play 'Shojo' (literally, "a kind of Japanese sea spirit with red face and hair and a fondness for alcohol").
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。用語補足しました。

sen.e: In 1939, he played the first Shite (protagonist) in "Iwafune."
In 1939, he played the first Shite (protagonist) in "Iwafune."
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: 1939: Played his first shite (lead role) in 'Iwafune' (boat-like rock).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。用語補足しました。

sen.j: 1948年 この年より観世華雪および観世雅雪に師事。
sen.e: In 1948, he started to learn under Kasetsu KANZE and Gasetsu KANZE.
In 1948, he started to learn under Kasetsu KANZE and Gasetsu KANZE.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: 1948: Began studying under Kasetsu KANZE and Gasetsu KANZE.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.e: In 1952, he performed "Dojo-ji Temple (Noh)."
In 1952, he performed "Dojo-ji Temple" (Noh).
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: 1952: Performed in 'Dojo-ji' (Dojo-ji Temple).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。用語補足しました。

sen.e: In 1953, he performed "Okina (an old man)."
In 1953, he performed "Okina" (an old man).
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: 1953: Performed in 'Okina' (old man)).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。用語補足しました。

sen.e: In 1957, he performed "Mochizuki (a full moon)."
In 1957, he performed "Mochizuki" (a full moon).
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: 1957: Performed in 'Mochizuki' (a full moon).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。用語補足しました。

sen.j: 1963年 社団法人京都観世会会長。
sen.e: In 1963, he became a chairman of Aggregate corporation, Kyoto Kanze Kai.
In 1963, he became a chairman of Aggregate corporation, Kyoto Kanze Kai.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: 1963: Became chairman of the Kyoto Kanze-kai Corporation.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.e: He also became a member of board of directors of training institution of Kyoto Kanze Noh.
sen.cmt: 「京都能楽養成会」は任意で訳しました。
sen.e: He also became a member of the board of directors of the training institution of Kyoto Kanze Noh.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Became director of the Kyoto Nogaku Yosei-kai.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.e: In1965, he became the board chairman of Kyoto Noh Association.
In1965, he became the board chairman of the Kyoto Noh Association.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: 1965: Became president of the Kyoto Noh Association.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 重要無形文化財保持者総合認定。
sen.e: He was generally recognized as the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property.
He was generally recognized as the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Certified as the holder of an Important Intangible Cultural Property designation.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 1967年 社団法人日本能楽会理事。
sen.e: In 1967, He became a member of board of directors of the Aggregate corporation, The Association for Japanese Noh Plays.
In 1967, He became a member of the board of directors of the Aggregate corporation, an Association for Japanese Noh Plays.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: 1967: Became director of the Japan Noh Association.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。ピリオド補足、スペル修正しました。

sen.e: In 1969, he performed "Sotoba Komachi."
In 1969, he performed "Sotoba Komachi."
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: 1969: Performed in 'Sotoba Komachi' (Komachi at the Gravepost).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。用語補足しました。

sen.e: In 1970, he performed "Obasute."
In 1970, he performed "Obasute."
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: 1970: Performed in 'Obasute' (Abandoning an Old Woman).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。用語補足しました。

sen.e: In 1981, he performed "Omu Komachi."
In 1981, he performed "Omu Komachi."
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: 1981: Performed in 'Omu Komachi' (Komachi's Parrot-Answer Poem).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。用語補足しました。

sen.j: 1983年 社団法人能楽協会理事。
sen.e: In 1983, he became a member of board of directors of Aggregate corporation, The Nohgaku Performers' Association.
In 1983, he became a member of the board of directors of Aggregate corporation, The Nohgaku Performers' Association.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: 1983: Became director of the Noh Association.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.e: In 1984, he won the Outstanding Performance Award in the Art Festival.
In 1984, he won the Outstanding Performance Award in the Art Festival.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: 1984: Won the Arts Festival award for excellence.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。補足しました。

sen.j: 1985年 片山九郎右衛門襲名。
sen.e: In 1985, he announced the succession to Kuroemon KATAYAMA's stage name.
In 1985, he announced the succession to Kuroemon KATAYAMA's stage name.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: 1985: Succeeded the stage name Kuroemon KATAYAMA.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.e: He won the Outstanding Performance Award in the Art Festival.
He won the Outstanding Performance Award in the Art Festival.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He won the Outstanding Performance Award in the Art Festival.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: He became a standing director of The Nohgaku Performers' Association.
He became a standing director of The Nohgaku Performers' Association.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Became standing director of the Noh Association.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.e: In 1987, he won the Outstanding Performance Award in the Art Festival.
In 1987, he won the Outstanding Performance Award in the Art Festival.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: 1987: Won the Arts Festival award for excellence.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.e: In 1990, he won the Award of the Japan Art Academy.
In 1990, he won the Award of the Japan Art Academy.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: 1990: Won the Japan Art Academy Prize.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 1991年 社団法人能楽協会理事長。
sen.e: In 1991, he became the board chairman of the Aggregate corporation, The Nohgaku Performers' Association.
In 1991, he became the board chairman of the Aggregate corporation, The Nohgaku Performers' Association.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: 1991: Became president of the Noh Association.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.e: In 1994, he received Shiju hosho.
In 1994, he received Shiju hosho.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: 1994: Awarded the Shiju Hosho (Order of the Purple Ribbon).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.e: In 1995, he became a member of the Japan Art Academy.
In 1995, he became a member of the Japan Art Academy.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: 1995: Became a member of the Japan Art Academy.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.e: In 1996, he was designated as the Bunkakorosha, (Person of Cultural Merits) of Kyoto City.
In 1996, he was designated as the Bunkakorosha, (Person of Cultural Merits) of Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: 1996: Designated a Bunka Korosha (Person of Cultural Merit) by Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 2001年 重要無形文化財各個指定(人間国宝)。
sen.e: In 2001, He was designated ass the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property-individual designation-(Living National Treasure.)
In 2001, He was designated as the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property and designated as a Living National Treasure.
sen.cmt: spelling, grammar, punctuation
sen.e: 2001: Designated an Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 2003年 京都府文化特別功労賞。
sen.e: In 2003, he received an award, Kyoto-fu tokubetsu bunka koro sho (the Award for Special Distinguished Service to Culture by Kyoto Prefecture.)
In 2003, he received an award, Kyoto-fu tokubetsu bunka koro sho (the Award for Special Distinguished Service to Culture by Kyoto Prefecture.)
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: 2003: Received the Kyoto Prefecture Cultural Lifetime Achievement Award.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。
